title: Requires written notification where a pharmacist is substituting a generic version of a drug product by one manufacturer for a generic version of a drug product by another manufacturer
summary: Requires written notification to patients where a pharmacist is substituting a generic version of a drug product by one manufacturer for a generic version of a drug product by another manufacturer.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1775

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ROSENTHAL  --  read once and referred to the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law,  in  relation  to  requiring  written
         notification  to patients where a pharmacist is substituting a generic
         version of a drug product by one manufacturer for a generic version of
         a drug product by another manufacturer

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 6816-a of the education law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    3    3. A PHARMACIST SHALL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO A PATIENT IF  HE
    4  OR  SHE  IS  SUBSTITUTING  A  GENERIC  VERSION  OF A DRUG PRODUCT BY ONE
    5  MANUFACTURER FOR A GENERIC VERSION OF A DRUG PRODUCT BY ANOTHER MANUFAC-
    6  TURER.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
    8  have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01778-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring written notification to patients where a pharmacist is substituting a generic version of a drug product by one manufacturer for a generic version of a drug product by another manufacturer
